file_manager module

class file_manager.FileManager(separator=',')[source]

Bases: object

Class to manage files.

This class handles the import and export of text files containing the coordinates of candidates and/or voters.

All input and export files must be placed in a directory called ‘files’.

In case of import, the file should follow a certain format shown to the user once the import button is pressed. If the file does not exist, or if one of its lines does not have a valid format, an error is shown and the import fails. If the file has a valid format in the totality of its lines, the import is successful and the points are shown on the graph.

In case of export, if there are no points on the graph, a message indicating so is shown. If the graph is populated with candidates and/or voters, a new file is created with a name following this convention : ‘donnees-“%d%m%Y-%H%M%S.txt”. This assures that no 2 files have the same name. The file contains the coordinates of the points classified under ‘Candidats’ or ‘Votants’. Its format is valid.

create_error_message(line: int, line_format: bool) → str[source]

Creates the message string to be displayed on error. If line_format is True, the format of the line is incorrect. If False, the coordinates given in that line are not in the correct interval.

Parameters:

  • line – the number of the line that contains the error

  • line_format – if True, the error is in the format, else in the coordinates

Returns:

the message to be displayed on error

export_objects_to_file(candidates: list[candidate.Candidate], voters: list[voter.Voter], on_error: Callable[[str, str], None], on_success: Callable[[str, str], None]) → int[source]

Creates a new file and writes the coordinates of the candidates and/or voters present on the graph in it. The file is created in the directory ‘files’.

import_objects_from_file(filename: str | None, on_error: Callable[[str, str], None], on_success: Callable[[list, list], None]) → int[source]

Imports the coordinates of candidates and/or voters from file and plots them on the graph.

Parameters:

  • filename – name of the file to import from

  • on_error – error callback

  • on_success – success callback
